III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/24/2025, two youths engaged in a verbal argument that
escalated to a physical altercation. Staff broke up the fight and
one youth was arrested. Two days prior, a safety plan had been
implemented to keep the youth separated.
Investigation Interview
Phone messages were left for Complainant on 01/29/2025 and
02/11/2025. A return call was not received.
Youth A was interviewed on 01/29/2025 at Beverly House. Youth
A stated she knew Youth E from a previous placement and they
did not get along. Youth A stated Youth E came back from school
on 01/24/2025 with an attitude. Youth A stated she finished
making pasta when Youth E came into the kitchen, mixed the
pasta, ate a bite and put the spoon back into the bowl of pasta.
Youth A stated she asked Youth E to leave because she did not
want Youth E to eat the pasta and they were on a special plan to
remain separate. Youth A stated Youth E remained in the kitchen
and placed pasta on a spatula like she was going to fling it at
Youth A. Youth A stated she threatened to slap Youth E if she
threw the pasta. Youth A stated Youth E said, “Slap me then” and
swiped the water bottle off the kitchen counter and left. Youth A
stated she ate her pasta, finished studying and washing dishes
when Youth E came back into the kitchen. Youth A stated Youth E
challenged Youth A to fight and threw a plastic bowl, plate, and
garbage can at her when Youth A did not respond. Youth A stated
she blocked the items from hitting her and threw a cup of
cranberry juice at Youth E. Youth A stated she tried to follow Staff
2 to the staff office but Youth E threw a fan at the door and started
to hit Youth A in the laundry room area. Youth A stated she and
Youth E hit each other and pulled each other’s hair. Youth A
stated Staff 1 redirected Youth E to let go of Youth A and ended
the fight when she stood between Youth E and Youth A. Youth A
stated Youth E left the laundry room area with Staff 1 and Youth A
remained with Staff 2 in the staff office. Youth A stated law
enforcement arrived and took Youth A’s statement for this
incident. Youth A stated she had a bruise below her left eye and a
2

scratch on her neck that have healed from this incident. Youth A
was not observed with either mark. Youth A stated Staff 1 and
Staff 2 verbally redirected Youth E in this incident but Youth E did
not follow their redirection. Youth A stated Beverly House staff are
not able to physically intervene in incidents.
Youth B was interviewed on 01/29/2025 at Beverly House. Youth
B stated Youth E was annoyed that she could not have her MP4
player during study time and wanted to start an argument. Youth B
stated Youth A directed Youth E to stay out of the kitchen when
she was making pasta. Youth B stated Youth E told Youth A that
she was allowed to be in the kitchen and that her pasta was
“nasty”. Youth B stated Youth E licked the spoon from the pasta
bowl and placed it back into the bowl before leaving the kitchen.
Youth B stated Youth E returned to the kitchen and challenged
Youth A to fight and started it by throwing a garbage can at Youth
A. Youth B stated Youth A threw cranberry juice back at Youth E
and ran to the laundry room. Youth B stated Youth E picked up a
fan and threw it at the laundry room door. Youth B stated she
followed staff direction and went to her room and did not see what
happened next. Youth B stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 were present
during the entire incident and redirected Youth E and Youth A to
stop arguing and to separate. Youth B stated she heard Staff 1
redirect Youth E to stop fighting Youth A.
Youth C refused her interview on 01/29/2025 at Beverly House.
Youth D was interviewed on 01/29/2025 at Beverly House. Youth
D stated Youth E was angry because she was not allowed to have
her MP4 player and began to argue with Youth A. Youth D stated
Youth E picked on Youth A to argue because they do not get
along. Youth D stated Youth E then threw a cup, trash can, and
fan at Youth A. Youth D stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 redirected Youth
E to go to her room but Youth E kicked her room door down once
she was in her room. Youth D stated she did not witness Youth E
and Youth A fight in the laundry room area but heard Staff 1 and
Staff 2 redirect Youth E to let go of Youth A and to stop fighting.
Youth E was interviewed on 01/30/2025 at her current placement.
Youth E stated she knew Youth A from a previous placement and
their relationship was never close. Youth E stated she became
upset about losing her MP4 player privileges and Staff 1 or Staff 2
redirected her to go to her room to collect herself after arguing
with Youth A. Youth E stated she does not recall what they argued
about. Youth E stated she went to her room, closed her room door
and started to kick her room door until it came off the hinges.
3

Youth E stated she exited her room and went to the kitchen and
threw a board game and trash can at Youth A. Youth E stated
Staff 1 redirected Youth E to leave the kitchen and to calm down.
Youth E stated she left the kitchen and Staff 2 tried to talk to her.
Youth E stated the next thing she remembers is hitting Youth A at
least twice in the laundry room area. Youth E stated Staff 1 stood
between her and Youth A and their fighting stopped. Youth E
stated “I was the aggressor. This is what happens when I get
angry.” Youth E stated Beverly House staff do not physically
manage youths and staff did everything they could to stop this
incident. Youth E stated she was not on a specific plan involving
Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/29/2025 at Beverly House. Staff 1
stated Youth E was not allowed to have her MP4 player during
study time. Staff 1 stated Youth E became upset and was
redirected not to use profanity and told she would receive her MP4
player after study time. Staff 1 stated Youth E was redirected to go
to her room after verbally going back and forth with Youth A. Staff
1 stated Youth E went to her room, knocked items off her dresser
and kicked down her room door. Staff 1 stated Youth E returned to
the kitchen and started again to argue with Youth A. Staff 1 stated
Staff 2 went to the staff office to call law enforcement for
assistance. Staff 1 stated she redirected Youth B, Youth C and
Youth D to go to their rooms for their safety. Staff 1 stated Youth E
picked up a fan and threw it at Youth A and then started to hit
Youth A in the laundry room area. Staff 1 stated Youth A hit Youth
E back and they pulled on each other’s hair. Staff 1 stated she
verbally redirected Youth E and Youth A to separate and calm
down. Staff 1 stated she moved towards Youth E and Youth A and
stood between them with her arms extended out to the side. Staff
1 stated Youth E and Youth A stopped fighting. Staff 1 stated
Youth E complied with the redirection to leave the laundry room
area and Youth A stayed with Staff 2 in the staff office. Staff 1
stated law enforcement arrived and took Youth E from Beverly
House. Staff 1 stated Youth E is not on a plan to remain separate
from Youth A. Staff 1 stated Youth E’s safety plan is for her to be
in an area away from peers when she becomes agitated.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 01/29/2025 at Beverly House. Staff 2
stated Youth E was upset and going back and forth with Youth A
in the kitchen. Staff 2 stated she redirected Youth A to not engage
with Youth E and Youth E was redirected to go to her room. Staff
2 stated Youth E went to her room, threw things in her room and
kicked her room door. Staff 2 stated she went to the staff office to
call for law enforcement assistance because Youth E continued to
4

escalate despite redirection. Staff 2 stated from the staff office she
heard Youth A scream and saw Youth A run into the laundry room
area followed by Youth E. Staff 2 stated Youth E and Youth A hit
each other until Staff 1 positioned herself between Youth E and
Youth A. Staff 2 stated Youth E and Staff 1 left the laundry room
area and Youth A remained in the staff office with Staff 2 until law
enforcement arrived. Staff 2 stated law enforcement spoke with
the youths and took Youth B from Beverly House. Staff 2 stated
Youth E has a safety plan to go to her room when she is agitated.
Staff 2 stated Youth E does not have a plan that keeps her and
Youth A separate at all times.
Video
Video footage reviewed shows Youth A yelling at 4:42:29 PM
presumably to Youth E in the side entrance foyer area. Youth E
enters the side entrance foyer area and hits Youth A at 4:42:41
PM. Youth E and Youth A yell, hit, grab and pull at each other.
Staff 2 is on the phone in the staff office with the door open. Staff
1 enters the side entrance foyer area, steps into the staff office,
exits, and positions herself between Youth E and Youth A with her
arms out to the side with a hand on Youth E’s forearm and her
other hand on Youth A’s forearm. Staff 1 redirects Youth E to stop
and let go. Youth E and Youth A release their hold on each other
at 4:43:01 PM. Youth E leaves the side entrance foyer area
followed by Staff 1. Youth A is upset and yelling and joins Staff 2
in the staff office.
Documentation
Staff 1 wrote an incident report dated 01/24/2025 that coincides
with her interview.
Youth E’s safety plan states she has a history of unpredictable
behavior, history of explosive temper and history of massive
property destruction. The safety plan states Youth E is to separate
from peers when she is verbally aggressive. The plan is not
specific to keeping Youth E and Youth A separate at all times.
Beverly House is a non-secure program. Youth room doors do not
lock. Beverly House staff are not trained in physical management
and is not authorized by Division of Child Welfare Licensing to
physically manage youths.
Tour
Upon entering Beverly House from the front door, one steps into
the living room. To the right of the living room is a full bathroom
and two double occupancy bedrooms. To the left of the living
5

room is a double occupancy bedroom with a full attached
bathroom. As one walks through the living room, it leads to the
dining room with a large rectangular table and chairs. To the right
of the dining room is a full kitchen. A den with couches, two
computer stations and a television is located directly past the
dining room. Stepping to the left of the dining room is a laundry
room. A sunken foyer area for the side entrance and a staff office
adjoins the laundry room.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance for providing for the needs,
protection and supervision of Youth A on 01/24/2025 when
provoked by Youth E. Interviews and video all indicated that staff
were present and making attempts to get the youth to separate. A
safety plan of keeping Youth A and Youth E separate at all times
does not exist.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
